title: Rear Suspension Unit - Inspection

body.body: Fully clean all components and inspect for damage or wear to:
The rear suspension unit upper and lower mountings
The suspension unit damper body and spring
The bottom needle bearing and seals
Check the swinging arm drop link bearings and seals for wear or damage. Replace as necessary.
Examine the drop and drag link bearings.
Never attempt to disassemble the rear suspension unit or preload motor (where installed). It contains fluid under pressure and serious injury could result if any part of the system is disturbed.
Inspect the preload motor assembly, and the connecting hose for damage and fluid leaks. If there is any damage, or fluid leaks are evident, the complete rear suspension unit must be replaced.
